text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Moslem-Croat federation deputies walked out of the Bosnian Serb republic National Assembly on Wednesday after being denied the right to vote, newspaper quotes state radio.

- According to the proposal from Michael Steiner, deputy to international High Representative for Bosnia, the new Bosnia council of ministers will consist of two co-presidents where one will be a Moslem and one Serb, three ministers from each national group and six ministerial deputies, the daily says, quoting diplomatic sources.
- Reconstruction programme for Bosnia over the next two years requires $2.5 billion, the World Bank's Sarajevo office chief Rory O'Sullivan says. --Sarajevo newsroom, +387-71-663-864.
